alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 7:13PM CST until February 02 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Wharton and Fort Bend Counties. San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Fort Bend, Wharton, Austin and Colorado Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 18.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 07/07/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 16.8 Sun 7 pm CST 18.0 17.7 16.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 715 AM CST.
